front.title: IEEE Draft Standard for Local and Metropolitan Area Networks: Secure Device Identity

author.organization: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers

front.abstract: A secure device identifier (DevID) is cryptographically bound to a device, and supports authentication of the deviceÂ¿s identity. Locally significant identities can be securely associated with an initial manufacturer-provisioned DevID and used in provisioning and authentication protocols to allow a network administrator to establish the trustworthiness of a device and select appropriate policies for transmission and reception of data and control protocols to and from the device.
